xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 25 July 2013
xwikidoc.content: <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 09:17 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 10:23 <misko_> has joined #medsavant 11:38 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 11:38 <bvancea> I just read: http://ebb.org/bkuhn/talks/LinuxTag-2011/compliance.html 11:38 <bvancea> I wasn't aware there are so many GPL violations going on 13:10 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 13:10 <sdumitriu1> Hey bvancea 13:10 <sdumitriu1> Most of the GPL violations are kind of "by accident" 13:11 <sdumitriu1> Hardware manufacturers have a long chain of providers 13:12 <sdumitriu1> The software comes from a second or third downstream provider that breaks the GPL requirements 13:12 <bvancea> I see, but once the violation is uncovered, aren't the third party providers held responsible? 13:13 <bvancea> I mean, I can imagine a chain of "we just got the code like this" 13:13 <bvancea> but it has to stop somewhere 13:13 <sdumitriu1> Yes 13:13 <sdumitriu1> Most of the violations are solved amiably 13:14 <sdumitriu1> It's rare that someone really refuses to provide the sources 13:14 <bvancea> I see 13:14 <sdumitriu1> But it does happen 13:22 <bvancea> and then they go to trial 13:22 <bvancea> although I'm sure what the point is, from the violating party's perspective 15:17 <marta> has joined #medsavant 15:20 <misko_> has joined #medsavant 15:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 15:29 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 15:33 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant
